intro: Alsinopsis caroliniana, commonly known as Carolina alsinomancer, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetlands. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Alsinopsis caroliniana is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered a rare species in its native range.
